1.text: Make a list of what you're looking for in a car.

2.text: Organize the list in terms of how important the criteria are to you.

3.text: Consider the advantages and disadvantages of buying a new car.

4.text: Consider the advantages and disadvantages of buying a used car.

6.text: Look for models that fit your criteria and budget.

7.text: Go to dealerships with no intention of buying.

8.text: Figure out what the dealership paid for the car(s) you're looking at.

9.text: Get online price quotes to use as bargaining chips.

10.text: Get your finances in order before you go to the dealership.

11.text: Be willing to walk away at any point in time.

12.text: If you plan on keeping the car for a good while, forget about leasing.

14.text: Walk away if the salesperson brings out a four-square worksheet.

16.text: Know the salesperson's tricks of the trade.

17.text: Try this clever trick, if you're willing.

18.text: Before buying a used car, take the car to a qualified mechanic for a complete pre-purchase inspection.

19.text: Before buying a used car, run a Vehicle History Report on the car.

20.text: Read the fine print carefully before you sign.
